wikipedia_page.main: Mark Forster (born 25 November 1964) is former professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1980s, 1990s and 2000s. He played at representative level for Great Britain, Ireland and Lancashire, and at club level for Woolston Rovers, the Warrington Wolves, and the Widnes Vikings, as a wing, or centre.

response: During the 1985/86 off-season Phil Blake traveled to England and played for Warrington, he played left-, i.e. number 4, (replaced by interchange/substitute Mark Forster) in Warrington's 8-34 defeat by Wigan in the 1985 Lancashire County Cup Final during the 1985–86 season at Knowsley Road, St. Helens, on Sunday 13 October 1985,

During the 1978–79 season, Fox played as a , and scored 3 goals in Bradford Northern's 18–8 victory over York in the 1978–79 Yorkshire Cup Final at Headingley Rugby Stadium, Leeds on Saturday 28 October 1978. Fox holds the most goals in RFL Yorkshire Cup Finals with 19, and the most points with 53 points. Fox, Alex Murphy and Mark Forster are the only British rugby league footballers to have had two Testimonial matches. Fox's were both at Wakefield Trinity, in 1966 and 1979.
